fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating Space and Linking it to the Jira service desk as a KB then removing it from Jira service desk will not reset Space permissions and Jira service desk users will be able to access the space with correct url.

h3. Environment
* Service Desk 3.8
* Confluence 6.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Varian 1
# Create space TEST in Confluence and 
# Log in to Confluence with Jira Service desk customer (unlicensed). 
# You will not be able to see space TEST even using direct URL to the space.
# Link the same space in JSD as a KB
# Log in to Confluence with Jira Service desk customer (unlicensed). 
# You will be able to see whole Space.
# Unlink the space in JSD.
# Log in to Confluence with Jira Service desk customer (unlicensed). 

Variant 2
# Create space TEST-A in Confluence and link it to JSD Project A
# Create space TEST-B in Confluence and link it to JSD Project B
# User A is Customer at JSD Project A 
# User B is Customer at JSD Project B
# User C is Customer at JSD Project A & B

h3. Expected Results
Variant 1
# You will not be able to see space TEST even using direct URL to the space.

Varian 2
# User A should be able to access Confluence KB A only (as he is not a customer of JSD project B)
# User B should be able to access Confluence KB B only (as he is not a customer of JSD project A)
# User C should be able to access Confluence KB A + B

h3. Actual Results
Variant 1
# User will be able to see whole Space.
 
Variant 2
# All Users will be able to see both spaces Space.

h3.Notes
New spaces are not affected by permissions. Only newly linked ones.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unlinking Space/KB in Jira Service Desk will not reset permissions for Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

If I have a page tree with the following setup:

- Parent Restricted Page (No users can view or edit by default)
-- Child of Restricted Page (No users can view or edit by default)

!parent-restricted.png|thumbnail!

!child-restricted.png|thumbnail! 

If I am an approved user of the Parent Restricted Page, I cannot view the Child of Restricted Page.

h3. Expected Behavior

- Upon browsing to the Child of Restricted Page in the above scenario, I encounter a "Request Access" prompt.
- Below is a screenshot of what the expected behavior looks like if a child page has restrictions but a parent page is unrestricted.
- Note: It is irrelevant how I got a link to the child page for the purposes of this bug. It could be linked in another page's content, or permissions manipulation may have temporarily exposed the page, etc.

 !restricted-parent-request.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Behavior

- I am informed that I do not have permissions to view the page.
- Below is a screenshot of what viewing the child page looks like as a user that has view/edit access to its restricted parent. The child page also has restrictions, as noted in the top two screenshots of this ticket.

 !restricted-denied.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Pre-requisites

- You must have two users: one that has the ability to create pages and edit permissions, and a separate user to test the 'Request Access' function
- You must have a configured mail server (Request Access will not appear if you have no mail server configured.)
- The "Confluence Request Access" bundled plugin must be enabled.

h3. Observations

- This behavior was encountered on 6.3.3 and 6.4.3.
- Prior to 6.3.3, we have received customer reports where this worked differently. Users were able to Request Access to child pages.
-- One customer reported they did not encounter this issue (anecdotally) from 6.2.4 and prior. It was only noticed after upgrading to 6.3.3.
- This only happens when *both* the Parent and Child pages have restrictions set to them. If a user has permissions to view a parent page and the child is set to 'no restrictions', they are able to view the page normally without requesting access.
fields.summary: Unable to Request Access to a child page with full restrictions, even if I have view/edit permissions on its restricted parent

fields.description:
We use Team Calendars for central releasemanagement planning.

One Team Calendars Event is created to manage one deployment packet. There are several teams. There is one Calendar for each year for each team.

The user (or several) who should deploy a packet, is added to the field "who" in one event.

Users are getting email notifications just because they are added to the field "who". They do not watch the Calendar, they do not watch the space or page the Calendar is linked or embedded in.

What we would like:

Either, the users in "who" are able to choose between receiving email notifications and not receiving email notifications, on global scale, or scale per Calendar. Somehow toggle it.

Or, the users which create or edit the Calendar events, are able to "notify whos" of Calendars, just like the check box "notify whatchers" on editing Confluence pages,  on a scale per Calendar.
fields.summary: In Team Calendars I would like to toggle if I would like email notifications if I am the user in "who" in an event

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion Description
It has been painful for customers with large dataset to migrate from an external database to another, for example, migrate from MySQL to PostgreSQL. The [current process|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrating-to-another-database-148867.html] consists of taking an XML backup and importing it to an empty instance pointing to the new database and then, after import is done, point the existing instance to the new database. Problem here is that XML Backups for large instances may take days and during these days, new data is being written to the instance, since huge instances can't be turned into read-only instances. It would be a *major win* for Atlassian customers to have a Migration Wizard Tool to transport data from one database to another through Confluence UI.

h4. Suggestion Details
BitBucket is an application that has this implementation and that allows administrators to easily migrate from one external database to another. Process is documented in the [Using the Database Migration Wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/connecting-bitbucket-server-to-an-external-database-776640378.html] BitBucket documentation. As this seems to be an implementation unrelated to the application itself, it may be possible to implement the same solution in other Atlassian applications, like Confluence.

h4. Suggestion Importance
Customers with huge datasets usually end up by developing their own solutions when upon the need of migrating to a different database, which turns into a project at their side that has costs and may turn into frustration using our tools. It would be a *{color:red}major win{color}* for everyone using Confluence to have this feature.

h4. BitBucket Wizard Example
!migrating.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Database Migration Wizard for Confluence

I can only view part of the sentence, so in order to proof what I just wrote I have to exit the properties screen. Then, hover over the image to make sure I didn't introduce typos. If I did, then it's edit the image > Properties > edit text all over again. Wash, rinse, repeat.

 

It would be super helpful if the Title and alt text input boxes were much bigger.

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement:
 # End user creates a page.
 # They add a table to the page in Collaborative Editor.  
 # A 3x3 table is sufficient to demonstrate the issue.
 # Attempt to highlight a row with the background cell color
 # This fails in the instance as a row will not be highlighted

h4. Steps to recreate:
 # Install a new instance of any of the affected versions listed of Confluence
 # Create a page
 # Add a 3x3 table as above
 # Attempt to highlight the middle row (not the header row) with a different background cell color
 # This will fail

h4. Workarounds:
 # Highlight a single cell at a time (tedious, but works) OR:
 # Use the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] and alter the tag for the table cell highlight from:
{code:java}
class="confluenceTdhighlight-$color" {code}
To the following:
{code:java}
class="confluenceTdhighlight-$color highlight-$color{code}

These two methods will work, but it appears that the editor is simply failing to complete the tag herein.
fields.summary: Highlighting Multiple Cells in Table does not work when selected

fields.description:
Currently you can programatically register macros using com.atlassian.confluence.macro.xhtml.MacroManager#registerMacro but there is no way to register a mobile friendly macro. Addons like Adaptavist ScriptRunner for Confluence register macros on the fly on startup and have no way of registering their macros as mobile friendly.

Some possible solutions:
 * Expose MobileMacroManager from the mobile plugin to allow programmatic registration of macros as mobile friendly
 * Read the device types in XhtmlMacroModuleDescriptor into MacroMetadata and update the mobile plugin to support checking via MacroMetadata
fields.summary: Provide a way to programmatically create a mobile friendly macro

Tasks without due date and assignee and on the same space are being ordered randomly on some pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Insert Tasks Report macro;

The tasks should be ordered with the same criteria, or even in the order of the task list, as per screenshot 1.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
If a link to anchor on a page has a *Link Text* that is identical to the page title, this text will not be saved. The text will revert to the *name of the anchor* rather than the chosen display text name upon page save.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Confluence page entitled "clickme"
# Create an anchor with the Anchor Macro. Call it "foo"
# On the same page, create a link to the anchor using Insert Link > Advanced:
** Set Link field to "#foo"
** Set Link Text field to "clickme"
# Insert the link and save the page

h2. Expected behavior
There is a link with display text "clickme" which links to the anchor

h2. Actual behavior
There is a link with display text "foo" which links to the anchor

h2. Workaround
Ensure that the Link Text field is not set to the same value as the page title.
fields.summary: The anchor Link Text cannot be saved if it is the same as the page title

fields.description:
Confluence by default enables following plugins: 
* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin core
* Confluence Hipchat Emoticons Plugin 
* Confluence Hipchat Integration Plugin 
* Confluence Hipchat Plugin 
Many users are not using Hipchat at all and don't need any Hipchat Integration plugin. 
Provide a feature (option visible in Confluence Administration -> General Configuration),  which disables all plugins related to Hipchat Integration. Currently it is required to disable all plugins selectively  by using  Confluence Administration -> Manage add-ons.
fields.summary: Disable option for  all Hipchat integration plugins from Confluence Administration panel

fields.description:
+User Case+:

Let's say after confluence-user A creates a page X with the restrictions being "only A can read and edit the page X "; however, a Confluence-administrator B can still read this page X,  edit it after even changing its restrictions.

In such case, the creator of page X , A, is not deemed as the owner of the page X; but B, the confluence-administrator, de-facto is, though not explicitly stated; which leads to that the Confluence-adminstrators have too much power and consequently Confluence-adminstrators-confidential info cannot be shared in Confluence, making Confluence less valuable as a knowledge base management tool.

 

+Expectation+

Disable the permission of confluence-administrator to over-control page restrictions (in other words, Confluence-administrators are subject to page restrictions just like  normal Confluence-users) or at least make it configurable by System-administrators.
fields.summary: Permissions of Confluence Administrators Override the Page Restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Calendar in Team Calendar cannot be removed due to more than 1000 events. 

h3. Environment
* Oracle Database only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure latest Confluence on Oracle with Team Calendars
# Create calendar
# Create more than 1000 events for that calendar
# Remove Calander 

h3. Expected Results
Deleting calendar removes the calendar

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
 2017-10-19 13:56:24,984 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-21] [calendar3.rest.ExceptionMappers.GeneralExceptionMapper] getResponseError General exception happen on calendar resources
 -- referer: http://<base-url>/wiki/calendar/mycalendar.action | url: /wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendars.json | traceId: e8fd0a07b99f1130 | userName: yd7.park
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:Oracle
	- version:Oracle Database 12c Enterprise Edition Release 12.1.0.2.0 - 64bit Production
With the Partitioning, OLAP, Advanced Analytics and Real Application Testing options
	- minor version:1
	- major version:12
Driver:
	- name:Oracle JDBC driver
	- version:12.1.0.1.0

java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.deleteWithSQL(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects.deleteWithSQL(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:281)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
This bug is specifically only for Team Calander that have more than 1000 events and using Oracle database.

h3. Diagnostic Step
Please use the SQL below to see if this bug is applicable to you before proceeding to the workaround step
{code:title=SQL query for all events in specific calander}
select * from "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" tc,"AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS" te where 
dBMS_LOB.INSTR( tc.name, '<Calendar >')>0 
and te."SUB_CALENDAR_ID" = tc."ID"
{code}
(i) Please replace the <calender> with the calendar name
(!) The SQL above have been tested but do necessary changes accordingly to the need of your instance. 

h3.Workaround
(i) This workaround will only work if you have more than 1000 events on the calendar
(!) Do note that this requires removing events from the database level. Please make the necessary backup

# Shut down Confluence
# Run the SQL Below
#* {code}
select tc."NAME",te."SUB_CALENDAR_ID"  from "AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS" tc,"AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS" te where 
dBMS_LOB.INSTR( tc.name, '<Calender')>0 
and te."SUB_CALENDAR_ID" = tc."ID"
{code}
# Note the SUB_CALENDAR_ID
# Run the SQL and replace the SUB_CALENDAR_ID
#* {code}
delete from "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS" where "SUB_CALENDAR_ID"='<SUB_CALENDAR_ID>'
{code}
# Start Confluence
# Remove Calender
fields.summary: Deleting Calendar from Team Calendar with more than 1000 events cause Oracle ORA-01795

fields.description:
In our [database migration documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/migrating-to-another-database-148867.html], we have a section saying that:
{quote}
The XML export built into Confluence is not suited for the backup or migration of large data sets.
{quote}

However, we did not provide customer to the factor that determine the size of the "large data" like JIRA have is documented below:
* [JIRA Sizing Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html]

Therefore, it is useful to include the information for Confluence specifically so that we are aware that XML backup is not a production friendly for specific instance size.
fields.summary: Include the factor/range to determine Confluence instance size in Database Migration Documentation.

h2. Steps to reproduce:
 # Install Confluence

 # Login as administrator users

 # Navigate to Administrations >  Global Templates and Blueprints

 # Edit any of the System Template , eg: Default Personal Space Content or Default Space Content

In the logs we will be seeing traces like below:
{code:java}
2017-11-08 21:50:35,545 ERROR [http-nio-9642-exec-1] [confluence.pages.actions.HeartbeatAction] startActivity No content found or no permission to view content with contentId: 0
 -- referer: http://localhost:9642/confluence642/plugins/createcontent/edit-template.action?pluginKey=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-default-space-content-plugin&moduleKey=spacecontent-personal | url: /confluence642/json/startheartbeatactivity.action | traceId: b3336d4cfc62e9e2 | userName: admindoe | action: startheartbeatactivity{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The error messages provided by the Jira Issues Macro do not always match up with the messages provided in the Jira UI. For example, if you perform a JQL query for a status that doesn't exist, Jira will give an error stating the value doesn't exist for the field 'status' but the Jira Issue Macro in Confluence will show JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.

h3. Environment
* Tested with Jira Software 7.3.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in Jira, TEST, create an issue (in this example I will use To Do)
# Add a Jira Issue Macro to Confluence with the following JQL:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
project = Test and status = "To Do" 
{code}
# Save the page
# In Jira, rename the Status to "Will Do"
#* Project settings > Workflows > Click the Pencil icon under actions > Click To Do status > Edit > Save
# Refresh the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Issue Macro table will display the message that Jira would:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
The value 'To Do' does not exist for the field 'status'.
{code}
 !Jira_error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The Jira Issue Macro table displays:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it. 
{code}
 !JIM-error.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro error messages do not match Jira error messages

 \{code}

h3. Expected Results

Label is deleted and the following output is shown in the console:

\{code}

 * Connected to quicksilver (127.0.0.1) port 80 (#0)
 * Server auth using Basic with user 'admin'
 > DELETE /confluence/rest/api/content/66755/label?name=test_lable HTTP/1.1
 > Host: quicksilver
 > Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
 > User-Agent: curl/7.43.0
 > Accept: */*
 > 
 < HTTP/1.1 204 No Content
 < Date: Wed, 08 Nov 2017 19:36:02 GMT

 < X-ASEN: SEN-L5422754
 < X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK

 < Cache-Control: no-cache, must-revalidate

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A Proxy Error screen will be displayed when attempting to generate an XML backup while running Confluence behind a proxy.
h3. Environment
 * Any version of Confluence
 * Running behind Apache reverse proxy in this example

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Cog Icon > Backup and Restore*
 # Start a backup of the instance
 # Wait a few minutes (until the proxy timeout is reached)

h3. Expected Results

Backup is completed with no error message.
h3. Actual Results

The following error will be presented to the user:

!Screen Shot 2017-11-08 at 4.37.01 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This error happens because the full site backup procedure does not have a progress bar to indicate the state of the operation. When the backup is started, the browser keeps waiting for the backup to complete as in the following screenshot (notice Waiting for host message at the lower left corner of the screen):

!Screen Shot 2017-11-08 at 4.36.38 PM.png|thumbnail!

If the instance is fairly large, the backup will take longer than the proxy timeout configured and result in the Proxy Error message shown previously. This is because there is no response from the application while the backup is being created.

Notice that the backup operation is not impacted. If you wait a for its completion, the backup will be available either in *<confluence-home>/backups* or *<confluence-home>/temp*. However, we do not have any indication of the process state besides checking if the backup file stopped growing and is zipped in the directory above.

A possible solution would be having a progress bar to this process, as we have for the XML import procedure.

This also affects other types of exports, like PDF ones.

h3. Workaround

(!) Increasing the proxy timeout is not feasible as the backup can take hours to complete
 # The first workaround is to wait for the backup to complete by checking <confluence-home>/temp. Once the file stops growing and a .zip file is created, the backup should be completed
 # The second workaround is to bypass the proxy and trigger the backup
fields.summary: Proxy Error occurs while exporting a full site backup

fields.description:
h3. Summary
we have developed a plugin where we listen for an AbstractLikeEvent. When it occurs, we want to use the BandanaManager to persist values in the database. This works before Confluence 6. Since Confluence 6, we can't save the information in the Bandana anymore. The (debug) log says, that it has saved the given information successfully in our own context, but when we are trying to get the keys for the specific context, it returns 0 items (although it said that the process was successful). After we have found the issue, we tried several Confluence versions. In Confluence 5 the BandanaManager works totally fine and as expected, but since Confluence 6 (until the latest version 6.5) the functionality seems to be broken. This problem only occurs when we are listening for AbstractLikeEvent's. When you try the same with e.g. a CommentCreateEvent, it works as expected (we set a value in our context and then fetch the keys from the BandanaManager). To make the issue more clear to you, we have prepared a minimal example plugin, where we are listening for the previously mentioned event and then try to save a value and get the Bandana keys. Please have a look in the example and try to reproduce the problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Handle the event AbstractLikeEvent
# Inside handleEvent, set the value using BandanaManager#setValue

h3. Expected Results
BandanaManager writes value to database

h3. Actual Results
BandanaManager does not write value to database

h3. Notes
Replicated in version 6.5.0 but works as expected in version 5.10.7
fields.summary: BandanaManager does not save value when listening for AbstractLikeEvent

fields.description:
h5. Summary
 * JVM "-Djsse.enableSNIExtension=false" parameter was added in setenv.shas a workaround to [error 'handshake alert: unrecognized_name' when setting up application links after upgrading Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/error-handshake-alert-unrecognized_name-when-setting-up-application-links-after-upgrading-confluence-753895174.html]. Permanent resolution can't be applied because of apache/oracle limitations
 * Then it is not possible to update any system or user plugins via Confluence Administration -> Manage add-ons.
This was working fine till September, when changes happened on Marketplace side

h3. Instance Details
 * Problem reproducible on instances 5.10, 6.4.3, 6.1, databases psotgreSQL 9.4 and H2, bundled Java 8

h3. How to Replicate
 * Install Confluence 6.4.3 (linux 64 bit) using default installation parameters and H2 database.
 * Download directly from marketplace any 3rd party plugin .jar file (use one or two versions below the most recent so that update option is possible)
 * Upload plugin manually by going to Confluence Administration -> manage add ons -> Upload add-on
 * Shutdown Confluence. Add following parameter to setenv.sh file
{code:java}
CATALINA_OPTS="-Djsse.enableSNIExtension=false ${CATALINA_OPTS}"  
{code}

 * Start Confluence, go to COnfluence Administration -> Manage add-ons. Try to update 3rd party plugin installed previously.
Update will not be possible, following message should be visible in application logs

{code:java}
 2017-10-10 08:59:16,876 ERROR [UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-3] [rest.resources.install.InstallFromUriTask] download Error downloading plugin from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.gliffy.integration.confluence/version/1004028 -- url: /rest/plugins/1.0/ | referer: https://eshare.advantest.com/plugins/servlet/upm | traceId

{code}
 
h3. Workaround
 * Remove the JVM Parameter "-Djsse.enableSNIExtension=false"
 * Add the correct ServerName/ServerAlias(ses) to the specific hosts in the Apache configuration as this article describes: [https://community.qualys.com/thread/13532]
fields.summary: Can't update system/bundled plugins when JVM flag "-Djsse.enableSNIExtension=false" is used

h3. Description
If the user is a JIRA service desk customer which is not counted toward the JIRA license and trying to access a page that contains JIRA issue macro or team calendar in an integrated knowledge base, the user will not able to view the JIRA issue. 

This is because the JIRA issue macro and team calendar will check if the user is a valid JIRA license user and also check if the user has the browse project permission. The JIRA service desk customer only has the permission to access the portal and not the project.

h3. Suggestion
Allow the JIRA service desk customer to view the JIRA ticket in confluence via JIRA issue macro and Team calendar.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h4. Scenario 1

When searching for a user in the page restrictions dialog, the user avatar image (or the default profile picture) is broken and the _alt_ text from the image is shown instead: 

 !restrictions.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Scenario 2

User avatar image is broken when mentioning a user in a page:

 !mention.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up Confluence with a context path 
# Create a user in Confluence
# Shutdown Confluence
# Change the base URL of the Confluence instance to another one, or remove the context path altogether
# Restart Confluence
# Create another user with a similar username as the one created in step 2
# Open the page restriction dialog on a page and search for the two users. 

h3. Expected Results

The users with thumbnails of their user avatars (or default profile pictures if no avatar was chosen) are shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The user created before the context path was changed will display a broken image in place of the thumbnail of their user avatar/profile picture. The user created after the context path change will display the thumbnail image correctly. 
 
h3. Notes

There were some similar problems but this is not the case.

* [Broken avatars/icons in Confluence after an upgrade due to corrupted cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/broken-avatars-icons-in-confluence-after-an-upgrade-due-to-corrupted-cache-329974322.html]
** Flushing the cache didn't solve the problem
\\
\\
* [After Adding a Context Path to the Base URL, Icons Appear as Broken Images|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/after-adding-a-context-path-to-the-base-url-icons-appear-as-broken-images-911933910.html]
** I confirmed that server.xml and confluence.cfg.xml had already been updated correctly

h3.Workaround

Rebuild the search index via the administration console. (See [User avatar breaks after changing the base URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/user-avatar-breaks-after-changing-the-base-url-940695233.html] for the detail.)
fields.summary: User avatar image breaks after changing the base URL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is no option in the front end to enable the option to be disabled. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To include autocomplete to be available at frontend for admins to disable. 

h3. Why this is important
This can be a vulnerability in companies that share computer 

h3. Workaround 
It is possible to modify the login.vm file (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+the+Login+Page) so that the os_password input box contains the attribute autocomplete="off"

Example: {code}
<input type="password" name="os_password" id="os_password" class="password " autocomplete="off"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Option for Autocomplete for username and password to be available on front end

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the context path is updated, the avatar thumbnail image does not display when using an @mention.  Testing revealed that this applied to any user whose profile picture was created before the context path change.  Problem does not occur for user profile pictures uploaded after the context path change.

h3. Environment
Confluence version 6.4.1 
Not dependent on OS, DB or browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user profile and add a avatar picture.
# Stop Confluence.
# Change the context path value within the server.xml and confluence.cfg.xml files.
# Start Confluence
# Create a page and add an @mention.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be found and their avatar thumbnail image should appear when being @mentioned. 

h3. Actual Results
While the user should be found, no avatar thumbnail image displays when being @mentioned.
 
h3.Workaround
# Locate every record in the content table with a title of 'user-avatar' created prior to the change in context path:
{code:sql}
select * from content where title = 'user-avatar' and creationdate > timestamp '2017-11-05 00:00:00';
{code}
# For every record returned, delete the corresponding records in the contentproperties table based on contentid.
# Likewise, delete the corresponding records in the imagedetails table based on contentid from content table equalling the attachmentid in imagedetails table.
# If there are entries in the content table with a value in the prevver column, delete these records. 
# Delete every 'user-avatar' record from the content table.
# In Confluence, rebuild the Content Index.
# For each user included in the delete statements above, readd their profile picture.
# When you do a subsequent @mention, you will need to type in a minimum of 3 characters before the profile thumbnail appears.

While this works, this will not be practical for larger user populations.
fields.summary: Context path changes causes @mention avatar thumbnail to not display

fields.description:
if you use a datasource with a factory attribute, such as the following:
{code:java}
<Resource name="jdbc/ConfluenceDS"
 auth="Container"
 type="javax.sql.DataSource"
 factory="org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.DataSourceFactory"
 initialSize="5"
 maxTotal="180"
 maxIdle="20"
 maxWait="30000"
 validationQueryweenEvictionRunsMillis="600000"
 removeAbandoned="true"
 removeAbandonedTimeout="300"
 driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
 url="jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/confluence"
 username="<database-user>"
 password="<password>"/>{code}

, rather than [the documented way|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-datasource-connection-937166084.html#Configuringadatasourceconnection-3.ConfigurethedatasourceinTomcat] , then confluence will fail to detect the driver class, and therefore fail to correctly pass the driver jar to synchrony (in server - this does not affect Data Center). 

Support zip containing the following text in the {{application.xml}} file will indicate this problem: 
{noformat}
<database-information>
...
<driver-class>
   com.atlassian.confluence.status.service.systeminfo.DatabaseInfo
</driver-class>
...
</database-information>{noformat}

Notice that the driver class information is incorrectly detected as 'com.atlassian.confluence.status.service.systeminfo.DatabaseInfo', rather than the correct driver (e.g., {{org.postgresql.Driver}}).

*Cause*: Confluence's code makes some assumptions about the classes returned by the datasource - see {{com.atlassian.confluence.status.service.DefaultSystemInformationService#retrieveConfluenceBasedInformation}} for the impl.

*Workaround*:
Remove the {{factory}} attribute, and use 
{code}
<Resource name="jdbc/confluenceDS" 
    auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
    username="<database-user>"
    password="<password>"
    driverClassName="org.postgresql.Driver"
    url="jdbc:postgresql://<host>:5432/<database-name>"
    maxTotal="60"
    maxIdle="20"
    validationQuery="select 1"/> 
{code}
fields.summary: synchrony fails when using a datasource connection that specifies a factory rather than a driver

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition and Why this is Important
When Confluence admin is trying to import a huge Space XML, the admin will not know the estimated time required for it to be completed _before_ the import starts and they might find the import is taking too long when the _Remaining Time_ is being shown *during* the import.

Currently, there is no proper way of canceling a Space Import that is already started. But interrupting the import progress may cause an issue such as the one explained in this Knowledge Base article:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/after-a-failed-space-import-it-s-not-possible-to-re-import-because-of-leftover-space-data-217743668.html
fields.summary: Allow XML Import to be Cancelled

fields.description:
Appears related to : CONFSERVER-40129 - Session timeout never occurred in Data Center.
h2. Summary

Session timeout never occurs in Confluence as configured within the {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}} file as it should as documented within [How to adjust the session timeout for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-adjust-the-session-timeout-for-confluence-126910597.html]

(i) Aside from Confluence Data Center, This has also been confirmed to affect Confluence server standalone.
h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Stop Confluence
 # Change {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/web.xml}} on each node as follows (Set session-timeout to 1 min):
{code:java}
<session-config>
  <session-timeout>1</session-timeout>
</session-config>
{code}

 # Start Confluence

h4. Expected Results

Session timeout should occur in 1 minute within the user session/web browser.
h4. Actual Results

Session timeout never occurs, and the user remains logged into the application.
h2. Workaround

*Option 1:*

Configure the maximum age of the 'remember me' cookie per: [Confluence Cookies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-cookies-160794071.html] by the following methods:
 # Edit {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/seraph-config.xml}} and add:
{code:java}
<!-- session-timeout remember-me cookie timer -->
<init-param>
	<param-name>autologin.cookie.age</param-name>
	<param-value>1800</param-value><!-- 30 minutes in seconds -->
</init-param>
{code}

 # Implementing this on all nodes, then restarting the whole cluster seems to force the session-timeout to work as expected.

*Option 2:*

Disable the automatic remember me on DC clusters, this allows the end user to decide to have a Tomcat short session or Seraph long session but the user may need to login in again on a new node.
 # Stop Confluence
 # Go to Confluence installation directory
 # Locate the {{<CONFLUENCE-INSTALLATION>/confluence/login.vm}} file and make a backup copy
 # Edit the file
 # Locate the following section of code:
{code:java}
#if ($action.shouldRememberMeCheckboxBeOmitted())
    <input type="hidden" name="os_cookie" value="true"/>
#else
    #bodytag( "Component" "label='remember.accesskey'" "name='os_cookie'" "value='false'" "theme='aui'" "template='onofflist.vm'") #end
#end
{code}

 # Modify the above code as follows
{code:java}
#bodytag( "Component" "label='remember.accesskey'" "name='os_cookie'" "value='false'" "theme='aui'" "template='onofflist.vm'") #end
{code}

 # Save the file and restart Confluence
 # Repeat the above steps each time you install a new version of Confluence
fields.summary: Session Timeout not respected in Confluence in Tomcat web.xml file
Improve performance when deleting comments or blog posts in spaces with many watchers

fields.description:
h3. Use Case

{quote}
Our Confluence is in a firewalled network.  It allows us to send out emails but all attachments are stripped.  This results in users receiving an email with a lot of broken image links, poor formatting, and a bunch of attachments that just say "sending attachments not allowed".

My goal is to edit the email templates to remove all {{img}} tags, thus preserving formatting, eliminating broken image links and the user wouldn't see any warnings from our IT dept about trying to send attachments.

We've been changing the soy templates in {{confluence-email-notifications-plugin-8.4.6.jar}} as explained at [Customizing Email Templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customizing-email-templates-168001822.html].  After much trial and error, we've been able to eliminate the {{img}} tags from these files.  We ignored the {{\*\-1.0.0.soy}} ones as we believe they are deprecated.

The problem is that the notification for page creations still sends an email with three attached images:
{code}
confluence-email-resources_view-page-email-adg-footer-item_icon.png
confluence-email-resources_add-comment-to-content-email-adg-footer-item_icon.png confluence-like_view-email-adg-content-item_icon.png
{code}
Looking at the source of the email, we don't see any {{img}} tags referencing these icons so we don't know why it tries to attach them. 
{quote}

h3. Suggestion

- Administrators would like to have an option in Confluence to strip images out of emails that the notification system sends out while still retaining other HTML elements such as links to the appropriate content. This would be to respect IT security policies where images are not allowed due to network restrictions.
- A plain-text option for emails would also suffice, as this would accomplish the same desired end goal of stripping images out of notification emails. However, the lack of HTML elements would impact usability for those emails.
fields.summary: Enable ability to remove all images in Confluence Notification Emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using a specific sequence (as explained in Steps to Reproduce) will break publish functionality in Confluence. And drafts will throw an error on publish.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.4.1
* Firefox (v.56) and IE11
* Chrome 64.0.3282.140 (not all versions of chrome affected)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open empty page in Firefox or Internet Explorer
# Paste image that was copied from any tool (you will see upload progress popup)
# Do a control-z to revert changes
# Paste content again (you will see upload progress popup)
# Publish page

h3. Expected Results
Page will be saved

h3. Actual Results
Page will throw the following error in logs and show a message that the page cannot be saved.

{code}
2017-11-01 12:39:12,853 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-70] [content.render.xhtml.DefaultFormatConverter] validateAndConvertToStorageFormat XhtmlException converting editor format to storage format. Turn on debug level logging to see editor format data.  -- referer: http://confluence-base-url/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=109020128&draftShareId=810eb33e-30d1-4b0f-8b5b-853e6e1cd5f8 | url: /rest/api/content/109020128 | traceId: a570c64579f08d75 | userName: conf.user com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (null) 	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.editor.EditorXhtmlTransformer.transform(EditorXhtmlTransformer.java:58)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
* Removing the image will not fix the issue
* Issue is not reproducible in Chrome (v. 61) and Edge (v. 40) 

h3.Workaround
Create a new page and copy/paste the content from the affected page 
You can also use [Source Editor for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] if copying page body does not work
fields.summary: Draft editor content corrupted when use CTRL+Z on attachment/image in Firefox and Internet Explorer

h3. Problem
Sometimes the users are not contributing to some space, e.g. the space contains an official process description. Of course if you are contributing to the document, you want to share your comments with the other contributors. However, sometimes you are just a consumer of the document and you just want to make some notes for some sections or statements.
h3. Suggestion
Allow marking the inline comments as private and in such cases show them only to the user that originaly created the comment.

fields.description:
*STEPS TO REPLICATE*
 # Navigate to Confluence Page > *Attachments*.
 # Attach *first version* of JPG image in the attachment.
 # Attach *second version* of the JPG image in the attachment with the same attachment name.
 # Click to preview the *first version* of the JPG image.

*EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR*
 Confluence preview the *first version* of the JPG image.

*ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR* 
 Confluence preview the *second version* (latest) of the JPG image but the URL is pointing to version=1:
{code:java}
<BASE_URL>/download/attachments/1966087/example.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1509703152000&api=v2{code}
*WORKAROUND*
 1 Convert the attachment into *.png* and reattach them.
 2. There is another workaround by manipulating the contentproperties
 * Note the CONTENTID of the JPG image
{code:java}
select contentid from content where title = '<JPG attachment title>' and contenttype='ATTACHMENT' {code}

 * Update the CONTENT table by replacing .jpg in the title by .png
{code:java}
update content set title='<title of attachment>.png',lowertitle='<title of attachment>.png' where
contentid in (select contentid from content where title = '<JPG attachment title>' and contenttype='ATTACHMENT'){code}

 * Update the CONTENTPROPERTIES table to change the MEDIATYPE property
{code:java}
update contentproperties set stringval='image/png'  where  propertyname='MEDIA_TYPE' and contentid in (select contentid from content where title = '<JPG attachment title>' and contenttype='ATTACHMENT'){code}

 * Flush the Cache or Restart Confluence to see the changes in UI

*Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any alter, insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first*

*NOTE*
 This bug currently affect only *.jpg* attachment
fields.summary: Older JPG attachment version preview the latest version in Confluence

Confluence plugins have version errors on start up causing incompatability

fields.description:
h4. Issue description 
Within Confluence datacenter version 5.10.8 and Confluence question plugin version 2.4.19, we've found 2 problems: 
# the topic created on node 1 does not appear on node 2
# the answered question being done on node 1 is still showing in the unanswered filter on node 2

h4. Reproduction steps
# Topic issue:
#* Set up a Confluence datacenter with 2 nodes
#* Create a new topic on node 1
#* Check the topic list on node 2
# Unanswered question filter issue:
#* Create a new question on node 1 then add an answer
#* Check the unanswered filter on node 2

h4. Expected behavior
# Topic: the new topic should show on node 2
# Unanswered filter: the answered question should not show in the filter result on node 2

h4. Actual behavior
# Topic issue: the new topic does not appear on node 2
# Unanswered filter issue: The answered question appears in the unanswered filter result on node 2 and showing that there is an answer.

h4. Workaround solution (if you can not upgrade to Confluence 6 shortly)
Disable and enable the Confluence question force the cache repopulation, however, the same issue will occur again on the newly created topic or question until next restart.
fields.summary: Confluence question topic and unanswered filter inconsistency between datacenter nodes

fields.description:
The following documentation should include some clarification about how the internal Synchrony proxy would be affected by setting proxyName/proxyPort in {{server.xml}}, based on what Tam Tran Minh said in [CONFSERVER-45726|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45726]:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/using-apache-with-mod_proxy-173669.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-behind-nginx-with-ssl-858772080.html

Also, from https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html:

{quote}
h5.With a reverse proxy

If you run Confluence behind a reverse proxy, you will connect to Synchrony via Confluence's internal Synchrony proxy. This is the default configuration with a reverse proxy, and a good choice if you do not want to open port 8091. SSL should be terminated at your reverse proxy.
{quote}

We seem to be telling customers that they will need to use the internal Synchrony proxy when running behind a proxy. But if customers follow our documentation to run behind Apache or nginx, they won't need the internal proxy. So this quote is somewhat confusing.

Perhaps we should clarify the quote above by letting customers know that they can either set up their proxy to use the internal proxy, or they can set up their proxy with specific Synchrony cconfigurations that don't need require the internal proxy.
fields.summary: Update Synchrony documentation relating to the internal proxy

fields.description:
h1. Current behavior
{panel}
The behavior below is true as per version 6.7.1
{panel}
Confluence administrator will add/delete groups from time to time in Confluence. Should for some reason that:
* The user directory where the user belongs to does not have the correct permission for Confluence Administrator to alter user memberships
** The user directory has "Read Only" permission
** The user directory is on "Read Only with Local Groups" and the group that was assigned to is not a local group

Admin will receive the following error on UI: "Could not add user 'xxxx' as a member of group 'confluence-administrators'. Check your server logs for more information"

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Upon checking atlassian-confluence.log, the following error message is observed:
{code}
2017-11-01 21:25:30,783 ERROR [http-nio-8632-exec-2] [bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor] addMembership Failed to add 'xxxxxx' as a member of 'group/1'
 -- referer: http://localhost:8632/confluence/admin/users/editusergroups-start.action?username=xxxx | url: /confluence/admin/users/editusergroups.action | traceId: 6cfe1311615c6e95 | userName: admin | action: editusergroups
com.atlassian.user.EntityException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationNotPermittedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Did not have update groups permission in any of the directories []
{code}

Resolution is to change the permission of the user directory accordingly.

h1. Desired behavior / Suggestions
# Have a better error message displayed so that Confluence Adminstrator does not need to go to the logs to find out the issue. Example error message that would be better:
{quote}
Unable to update user into group: The directory: XXX does not have "Write" Permission. Check the KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=302812802 
{quote}
# Hide the "Edit Groups" option when the User Directory is on "Read Only" permission
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Provide warning in the UI, similar to the behavior seen in Crowd 3.1.1:
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve UI logs during failure on updating users to groups due to insufficient user directory permission

h3. Summary
In the article, [How to grant access to one space only to a user in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-grant-access-to-one-space-only-to-a-user-in-confluence-815244321.html?_ga=2.163842495.12876358.1509353586-1729042927.1506935118], it mentions in step 7 and 8 to go to *Application Access* from the User Management and grant *can use* access there.

The article refers to Confluence Server 6.5. However, I have tested on both 6.5.0 and 6.4.3 but neither have an Application Access menu item in User Management.

However, Cloud does, so I'm starting to think this documentation is directed at Cloud users. We therefore need a Server equivalent of this article and it should be re-categorized if appropriate.

Confluence Server 6.5

# Navigate to User Management in Confluence Server {{admin/users/browseusers.action}}

h3. Expected Results
Should have a *Application Access* menu item according to article.

h3. Actual Results
I suspect the actual article would have us go to View Global Permissions. {{admin/permissions/globalpermissions.action}}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Current embedded JRE has some vulnerabilities which have been resolved in critical security update Java 1.8.0.161. Many larger companies which have a dedicated security team will ask their Confluence system admin to update the Java version to the new critical security update. Which forces the JIRA system admin to sway away from sticking to the embedded version.

[https://www.java.com/en/download/faq/release_changes.xml]
h3. Suggested Solution

Test and bundle with the latest Java 1.8.0.161 into the new update of Confluence.
h3. Workaround 

If the customer is requested to update Java before a new Confluence release with the required java update comes out, they can update their Java versions manually by following these KB articles;

[Installing JDK|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-java-for-confluence-144212101.html]

[How to switch from the bundled JRE to System Java when using Confluence as Windows Service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-switch-from-the-bundled-jre-to-system-java-when-using-confluence-as-windows-service-610435746.html]

[How to use system Java instead of the bundled JRE|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-system-java-instead-of-the-bundled-jre-302811269.html]
fields.summary: Embed latest java critical security update (1.8.0.161 or higher) into the next Confluence (sub)version

fields.description:
When using the *Edit in Office* feature, every time a user clicks "Save" button in Office, a new revision of the document is stored in Confluence. While saving is a good practice to avoid losing content, this leads to attachment revision spam.

The suggestion is to somehow improve this behavior. One possible solution would be saving temporary files somewhere on the server for each save and consolidate as an attachment version only when the user closes the Office program, meaning that the editing session is indeed finished.
fields.summary: Improve attachment version behavior when using Edit in Office
